node_editor.node_graphics_node module¶

class node_editor.node_graphics_node.GraphicsNode(node: Node, parent=None, resizeable=True, min_width=180, width=180, min_height=240, height=240)¶

onSelected()¶

onSelected event

mousePressEvent(event: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) → None¶

Overrides Qt’s mousePressEvent. :param event: current event :type event: QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent

mouseMoveEvent(event: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) → None¶

Mouse move event

Handle two cases :

  • either the Graphical Node is resizeable and a handle is selected, the trigger the resize event

  • or the node is selected and update the Graphical Socket and Graphical Edge.

Parameters

event (QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) – event trigerring the mouseMoveEvent

mouseReleaseEvent(event: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent)¶

Mouse Release Event

On release, if moved, trigger storeHistory from SceneHistory. Also handles selection of the node and triggers onSelected event. :param event: event triggering the mouseReleaseEvent :type event: QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent

mouseDoubleClickEvent(event: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent) → None¶

Overrides double click event. Resent to Node::onDoubleClicked

wheelEvent(event: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsSceneWheelEvent) → None¶

wheelEvent on the GraphicsNode. Avoid the wheelEvent from the GraphicsScene.

hoverEnterEvent(self, QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent)¶
hoverLeaveEvent(self, QGraphicsSceneHoverEvent)¶
resize(rect: PyQt5.QtCore.QRectF)¶

Update rectangle and bounding rectangle

getSocketPosition(index: int, position: node_editor.node_socket.SocketPosition, num_out_of: int = 1) → List[float]¶

Helper function - returns the position of a socket in pixels relative to the Graphical Node

Parameters

  • index (`int`) – Index of the socket in the list

  • position (SocketPosition) – One of enumeration

  • num_out_of (`int`) – total number of Socket on this position

Returns

x, y position relative to the node

Return type

`list`

updateSocketAndEdges()¶

Update the Socket position and the Graphical Edges when available

updateHandles()¶
updateLayout()¶

Updates the layout.

Updates : - Socket position - Edges connected to the node - Position of the handle to resize - Size of the content
